title: Christine Doig Cardet - PyCon Colombia 2018
description:
PyCon Colombia 2018 es la segunda conferencia de Python en Colombia. Christine Doig Cardet, Senior Product Manager and Data Scientist at Anaconda, Inc es una de las disertantes principales y nos invita todos a unirnos a este gran evento. 

Adicionalmente contamos con otros grandes keynote speakers como: 

Audrey Roy Greenfeld - Co-author two scoops of django
Deborah Hanus, Investigadora de Machine Learning y emprendedora
Daniel Roy Greenfeld - Co-author two scoops of django 
Naomi Ceder - PSF Chair of board of directors 
Lorena Mesa - Director at Python Software Foundation 
SSatya Mallick - Computer Vision Expert, founder of Big Vision LLC. 

Algunos datos sobre PyCon Colombia 2018: 3 días de conferencia con 7 Keynote speakers +  30 Speakers de diversos tópicos  + 15 talleres + 400 asistentes estimados +40 Voluntarios 



Compra tus entrada aquí https://pyconcolombia2018.eventbrite.com

title: Naomi Ceder - Antipatterns for Inclusion - PyCon Colombia 2018
description:
Naomi Ceder
----------------------
OS Dev Manager at Dick Blick Art Materials
Chair of Board of Directors at Python Software Foundation
Keynote Speaker at PyCon Colombia 2018

Anti-patterns for inclusion
--------------------------------------------
Naomi Ceder, Chair of Board of Directors at Python Software Foundation, closed the second day of the conference talking about how diversity brings benefits for every community, population, team and organization and how a diverse team is better at solving problems and is even more profitable and creative. She shared with the audience her perspective, inviting the audience to think always about inclusion when referring to diversity and the many obstacles that get in the way while trying to promote them. Naomi highlighted that society needs more education on the topic of inclusion, take more responsibilities and not leave the solution to the minorities themselves. This requires listening to people representing this minorities and understanding that diversity has many dimensions including economic, gender, race, religion, sexuality among others.

About PyCon Colombia 2018
--------------------------------------------------

We are excited to share this overview of the second edition of Colombia’s Python Conference: PyCon Colombia 2018  - http://bit.ly/overview-pyconcolombia2018

We want to say thanks to all our sponsors who helped make the conference a huge success.

title: Isabel Ruiz Buritica - Painting chaos with Python - PyCon Colombia 2018
description:
Isabel Ruiz Buritica
----------------------
Developer at EBS Ltda.

Painting Chaos with Python
--------------------------------------------
If you want to start building computational designs with patterns beyond the simple ellipse (), rect () and line () forms, it's time to learn about concepts and techniques to simulate the geometry of nature: fractals.

We will review two ways to generate fractals, first, a function that is recursively called and that will always produce the same result in each iteration, applies to classical fractals such as the Cantor set, the Sierpinski triangle, binary trees, etc., and second, combine the recursive algorithms with randomness and generate a different and more realistic result in each iteration, for example, we could use a random color, line thickness, orientation, etc. It applies to complex fractals such as the Koch curves, the Mandelbrot set, and the julia set. The recursive fractal tree is a good example of a scenario in which adding a bit of randomness can make the element look more natural.

title: Satya Mallick - Computer vision Machine learning & AI - PyCon Colombia 2018
description:
Satya Mallick
----------------------
Founder / Partner at Big VIsion LLC
----------------------

https://www.linkedin.com/in/satyamallick/
https://twitter.com/learnopencv
https://github.com/spmallick
https://www.facebook.com/spmallick

----------------------

Keynote Speaker at PyCon Colombia 2018
Computer vision Machine learning & AI
--------------------------------------------
Dr. Satya Mallick was recently named one of top 30 AI people to follow on Twitter for 2017 by IBM's AI blog. He is the founder of Big Vision LLC, a San Diego, California based company that specializes in computer vision, machine learning, deep learning and artificial intelligence consulting services and products. He is also the principal author of a popular computer vision blog http://www.learnopencv.com .
Dr. Mallick is an accomplished computer vision and machine learning scientist and engineer. He has worked on a variety of problems including face processing ( detection, recognition ), object recognition using deep learning, computational photography, augmented reality, document analysis, 3D reconstruction, medical image processing, and 3D cryo-electron microscopy to name a few. He has published several research papers in top notch conferences and journals.
At Big Vision LLC, Dr. Mallick and his team work with companies to solve computer vision and machine learning problems that have huge real world impact in terms of speed and accuracy of algorithms, reduction in manual work, and identification and creation of intellectual property.
Prior to starting Big Vision, Dr. Mallick had co-founded and was the CTO (R&D) of Sight Commerce Inc. — a computer vision company that creates vision and learning solutions for the beauty and fashion industry. He oversaw research, design and implementation of computer vision and machine learning algorithms and systems.
Dr. Mallick did his Ph.D. from the University of California, San Diego.

title: Jose Ricardo Zapata - Audio signal analysis with python -  PyCon Colombia 2018
description:
Jose Ricardo Zapata
----------------------
Lecturer and Researcher at Universidad Pontificia Bolivariana
----------------------
The automatic content analysis of musical audio signals has received
increasing attention from the research community, specifically in the
field of music information retrieval (MIR). MIR aims to retrieve
musical pieces by processing not only text information, such as artist
name, song title or music genre, but also by processing musical
content directly from de audio signal in order to retrieve a piece
based on its rhythm or melody. In order to build a computer system
capable of intelligently processing music, it is essential to design
representation formats and processing algorithms for the content of
music.
The main idea of the talk is show how python is used in audio
processing and analysis, nowadays in audio research python is the
most used language which for years was dominated by the use of
MATLAB.
----------------------
https://www.facebook.com/joser.zapata
https://www.linkedin.com/in/jose-ricardo-zapata-gonzalez-2259aa85/
https://twitter.com/joserzapata
https://github.com/JoseRZapata

title: Lorena Mesa  - Your model is bias, but so is your data. The case for ethics in data science.
description:
Lorena Mesa
----------------------
Software eng. /Data Scientist at Sprout Social
----------------------

Social networks:

https://github.com/lorenanicole
https://www.linkedin.com/in/lorenamesa/
https://twitter.com/loooorenanicole
https://www.instagram.com/loooorenanicole

----------------------

Keynote Speaker at PyCon Colombia 2018
Your model is bias, but so is your data. The case for ethics in data science.
--------------------------------------------
Political analyst turned coder, Lorena Mesa is a Sprout Social software engineer on data science, Director on the Python Software Foundation, PyLadies Chicago co-organizer, and Tech Ladies Chicago city organizer. Lorena loves to make meaning out of data, asking big questions and using her code to build models to derive that meaning. Part Star Wars fanatic but mostly a Trekkie, Lorena abides by the motto to "live long and prosper".
My passion and curiosity to understand complex problems and the impacts that these problems have on social networks and social spaces has been a common thread in my work. The transition from applied research in the social sciences and public relations to software development is an obvious and exciting option for me. The software responds to the problems of people, the problems that inspire me.
Implementing solutions that makes the organic mining of social media traffic look easy, reflecting on consumers' buying data to find stories, discuss and design sustainable and flexible code are the types of problems I'm anxious about. my code to pursue.
--------------------------------------------------
About PyCon Colombia 2018
--------------------------------------------------
We are excited to share this overview of the second edition of Colombia’s Python Conference: PyCon Colombia 2018  - http://bit.ly/overview-pyconcolombia2018

title: Jorge Martínez - Detection vs Tracking: A computer vision approach - PyCon Colombia 2018
description:
Jorge Martinez
----------------------
Software Engineer at Piensa Labs / Lecturer at Universidad 
--------------------------------------------

Social Networks Speaker:

https://github.com/JorgeMartinezG
https://twitter.com/_JorgeMartinezG
https://www.linkedin.com/in/jorgemartinez-0327/
https://www.facebook.com/jorge.martinezgomez.12

--------------------------------------------

Detection vs Tracking: A computer vision approach
--------------------------------------------
Computer vision literature exhibits many object tracking and detection methods. Detectors use trained models based on general attributes. Furthermore, trackers learn specific features.

Here, I present a tracking algorithm which combines both approaches leveraging common problems presented in videos.

title: Interview Lorena Mesa  - Keynote Speaker - PyCon Colombia 2018
description:
Lorena Mesa
----------------------
Software eng. /Data Scientist at Sprout Social
----------------------

Social networks:

https://github.com/lorenanicole
https://www.linkedin.com/in/lorenamesa/
https://twitter.com/loooorenanicole
https://www.instagram.com/loooorenanicole

----------------------

Keynote Speaker at PyCon Colombia 2018
Your model is bias, but so is your data. The case for ethics in data science.
--------------------------------------------
Political analyst turned coder, Lorena Mesa is a Sprout Social software engineer on data science, Director on the Python Software Foundation, PyLadies Chicago co-organizer, and Tech Ladies Chicago city organizer. Lorena loves to make meaning out of data, asking big questions and using her code to build models to derive that meaning. Part Star Wars fanatic but mostly a Trekkie, Lorena abides by the motto to "live long and prosper".
My passion and curiosity to understand complex problems and the impacts that these problems have on social networks and social spaces has been a common thread in my work. The transition from applied research in the social sciences and public relations to software development is an obvious and exciting option for me. The software responds to the problems of people, the problems that inspire me.
Implementing solutions that makes the organic mining of social media traffic look easy, reflecting on consumers' buying data to find stories, discuss and design sustainable and flexible code are the types of problems I'm anxious about. my code to pursue.
--------------------------------------------------

title: Deborah Hanus - With great machine learning comes great responsability - PyCon Colombia 2018
description:
Deborah Hanus
----------------------
Machine Learning Researcher & Entrepreneur
----------------------

https://www.linkedin.com/in/deborahhanus/
https://twitter.com/deborahhanus
https://github.com/dhanus
https://www.facebook.com/deborah.hanus

----------------------

Keynote Speaker at PyCon Colombia 2018
Machine Learning Researcher & Entrepreneur
--------------------------------------------
Deborah Hanus.

I study machine learning at Harvard University as an NSF Fellow working with Finale Doshi and Ryan Adams. I enjoy working on projects in the intersection of software, machine learning, and behavior.

I graduated from MIT with a M.Eng. in Electrical Engineering & Computer Science and a double-Bachelor's in Computer Science and Brain & Cognitive Sciences. As a Master's student, I worked with David Wingate, using reinforcement learning to schedule process threads on Tilera, a multicore chip. As an undergraduate, I worked with Ed Vul in Kanwisher Lab on a variety of projects, publishing several papers focused on uncertainty and visual attention.

In the intervening time, I've worked as a software engineer and a Fulbright Scholar in Cambodia, learning how education can translate to job creation.

title: Christine Doig - Data Science past, present and future - PyCon Colombia 2018
description:
Christine Doig Cardet
----------------------
Data Scientist
----------------------

https://www.facebook.com/christine.doig.12
https://www.linkedin.com/in/christinedoigcardet/
https://twitter.com/ch_doig
https://github.com/chdoig

----------------------

Keynote Speaker at PyCon Colombia 2018
Data Science past, present and future
--------------------------------------------
Christine Doig.

I love empowering people through data science and open source technology.

5+ years of professional experience in analytics, operations research, and machine learning in a variety of industries, including energy, manufacturing, banking and defense. Worked with a variety of software and programming languages, including Matlab, Excel, SAS, R, Python and Hadoop. Adaptive and always eager to learn. Thrived in cross-functional teams with Engineering, Product, UX, Sales and Marketing. Empathetic and good listener.

Speaker and trainer at many Open Source conferences, including PyCon, EuroPython, SciPy, and OSCON, and local meetups, such as ACM SIGKDD Austin, PyBCN and PyLadies. Topics include: Interactive Data Visualization, Machine Learning, Topic Modeling, Data Science Reproducibility, Best Practices and Ecosystem Overview. Excellent storytelling skills and great at presenting complex subjects to non-technical and beginner audiences. Occasional blogger, writer and webinar presenter.

M.S. in Industrial Engineering from the Polytechnic University of Catalonia in Barcelona. Master Thesis at RWTH Aachen, Germany. Lived in three different countries (U.S., Spain and Germany) and proficient in four languages (English, Spanish, Catalan and German). Love traveling and movies.

description:
Javier Mansilla
----------------------
CTO at Machinalis
--------------------------------------------
Social Networks:

GitHub: https://github.com/jmansilla
Twitter: https://twitter.com/dozalbos
--------------------------------------------
Python and data Science in E-Commerce: A sucess story
--------------------------------------------
The aim of the talk is to convey the experience of a Data Science team in a real case and that is currently in production. The attendees will get in touch with the problems faced by the teams on a day-to-day basis, and how the choice of Python as a base language allows sufficient flexibility to provide solutions to all.

Presentation of the case Initial challenges. Organization of work. Articulation with the client for experimentation and the development and training of models. Engineering and production start-up Impact of the solution on production in the life of the client and its users.

title: Manuel Kaufmann - What is the Python Software Foundation? - PyCon Colombia 2018
description:
Manuel Kaufmann
----------------------
Developer at Read The Docs / Founder of Argentina en Python / PSF Ambassador in Latin America
--------------------------------------------
Social Networks:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/kaufmann.manuel
Twitter: https://twitter.com/reydelhumo
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/__humitos__/
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/manuelkaufmann/
GitHub: https://github.com/humitos
--------------------------------------------
What is the Python Software Foundation?
--------------------------------------------

The talk proposes a kind of forum where a main initial line is proposed on "What is the PSF and its role in the community" explaining its philosophy and purpose. Then, a set of questions are proposed by the speakers inviting the audience to eliminate their doubts about the function of the foundation, thus achieving a forum between speakers and the audience.

Finally, the roles that exist within the PSF are explained and the audience is invited to be part of the foundation.

title: Aftermovie 2018 - Pycon Colombia 2018
description:
Watch the aftermovie of PyCon Colombia 2018.

Don't miss it!!

PyCon Colombia 2018 was a great success. Thanks to our sponsors, collaborators and attendees who made this event even bigger than we expected.

We are confident #PyConColombia2020 will be even better. In Feb 2020 #PyConColombia will return with amazing guests from different countries, who will be happy to share their ideas, experiences and knowledge with the community

Mira el aftermovie de PyCon Colombia 2018

¡No te lo pierdas!

PyCon Colombia 2018 fue un gran éxito y todo esto fue gracias a nuestros patrocinadores, colaboradores y asistentes que hicieron de este evento aún mas grande de lo que esperábamos.

El equipo está trabajando fuertemente para que #PyconColombia2020 sea aún mejor y en febrero de 2020 PyCon Colombia regrese con grandes invitados de diferentes paises, los cuales estarán encantados de compartir sus ideas, experiencias y conocimientos con toda la comunidad.
